abstract: Microsoft agreed to buy Yammer, an operator of private social networks for business, for $1.2 billion in cash, signaling a change in the communication habits of big companies.
snippet: Microsoft agreed to buy Yammer, an operator of private social networks for business, for $1.2 billion in cash, signaling a change in the communication habits of big companies.
lead_paragraph: Plenty of people goof off at the office by checking their Facebook accounts. Now Microsoft is paying $1.2 billion for a company that has made Facebook-style social networking just another tool for getting work done.

headline.main: Microsoft Enters Office Socializing in $1.2 Billion Deal

byline.original: By Nick Wingfield and Evelyn M. Rusli
